meanings.definition: The act of incorrectly orienting or positioning something.
meanings.sent1: The misorientation of the map led us in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent2: Her misorientation of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete.
meanings.sent3: The misorientation of the bookshelf made it look like a modern art piece.
meanings.sent4: His misorientation of the telescope made the stars appear closer than they really were.
meanings.sent5: The misorientation of the sign caused confusion among the visitors.

meanings.definition: A state of being confused or disoriented.
meanings.sent1: The sudden misorientation left him feeling lost in the unfamiliar surroundings.
meanings.sent2: Her misorientation after waking up in a new place made her anxious.
meanings.sent3: The misorientation at the amusement park turned into a funny adventure.
meanings.sent4: The misorientation in the maze felt like being trapped in a dream.
meanings.sent5: The misorientation during the blackout was disconcerting for everyone.

meanings.definition: A deviation from the correct or proper orientation.
meanings.sent1: The misorientation of the painting on the wall made it look crooked.
meanings.sent2: His misorientation of the camera angle resulted in a blurry photograph.
meanings.sent3: The misorientation of the road sign caused confusion among the drivers.
meanings.sent4: Her misorientation of the timeline made it difficult to follow the events.
meanings.sent5: The misorientation of the compass needle led them off course.
